content: I don't have knowledge of the specific circumstances of your puppy's crying. however, in general, it is not recommended to let your puppy out of their crate if they start crying at night. instead, you should try to determine the cause of their crying, as it could be a sign that they need to go outside to relieve themselves, they are hungry/thirsty or they want attention. once you have ruled out any immediate needs, you can try to comfort them with a soothing voice or by providing a chew toy or blanket. it is important to remain patient and not to give in to their crying or angry outbursts, as this can reinforce the behavior and make it more difficult to train them to stay in their crate peacefully. with proper crate training, most puppies can learn to enjoy their crate and sleep through the night without any fuss.
